text:
Created attachment 25904
sample to reproduce the problem

Please render the attached .fo files to see the problem, e.g.
fop -fo messed-up-sample.fo -awt
(pdf renderer shows the same problem)

Please find attached a zip file with two .fo files, one with usage of space-before attributes and a messed up result. The other is the same but without the space-before attributes with appropriate result. There's also an svg image file of a box to fill up space on the page.

Please adjust the url in the fo:external-graphic element in the attached .fo files appropriate to your environment.
creator: Antti.Karanta@napa.fi
gadams@apache.org
text: resetting P2 open bugs to P3 pending further review

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: please provide *minimal* FO file that demonstrates problem; also provide PDF output file showing problem

creator: gadams@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> please provide *minimal* FO file that demonstrates problem; also provide PDF
> output file showing problem

Antti, I am still awaiting your input as requested above. if I see no further input by April 30, I will close this bug due to lack of requested information. Regards, Glenn

creator: Antti.Karanta@napa.fi
text:
I tried reproducing the problem but fop-1.0 seems to raise an exception:

org.apache.fop.apps.FOPException: Requested page number is out of range: 0; only 0 page(s) available.

It's been so long since I filed this issue that I have forgotten the details but I'm fairly certain I did not get this exception previously. 

I will be fairly busy in the near future and won't likely find any time to put into this. So it may be better you close this issue and I'll reopen it once I find the time to play with it again and can provide a minimal reproduction sample.

creator: gadams@apache.org

thanks; please do reopen if you can provide a test input file that reproduces the problem; i'm hoping in the future we can greatly reduce the FOP bug turn around time so that reporters won't forget the details
batch transition resolved+later to closed+later; if you have new information or a patch that addresses the issue, you may reopen
creator: gadams@apache.org
